dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple Inc. (AAPL): Integrating AI in Devices for Personal Privacy
News Content: We recently published a list of Coatue’s 35 Most Important AI Stocks. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against Coatue’s other most important AI stocks.

Artificial intelligence (AI) has fueled a major rally in the technology sector, driving up key market indices. Over the past year, the S&P 500, heavily influenced by tech giants, has risen by nearly 22%, while the tech-heavy NASDAQ Composite has surged over 26%. Initially, market analysts had predicted an increase in interest around growth options for 2024 due to easing inflation and potential rate cuts. However, AI has taken this expected interest and amplified it into an economy-wide wave of optimism. While tech stocks have been the primary beneficiaries, AI’s influence is expanding across industries such as manufacturing, supply chain, transportation, entertainment, and retail.

Investment in AI is growing rapidly across various sectors. A recent Goldman Sachs report estimates that global businesses will invest nearly $1 trillion in AI infrastructure over the next few years. Venture capital (VC) investments in AI startups are also on the rise. In the first half of 2024 alone, VC firms made approximately 200 AI-related deals, injecting nearly $22 billion into the sector. The average AI startup funding round now exceeds $100 million, with company valuations averaging over $1 billion. In contrast, non-AI startups typically receive around $20 million in funding and have valuations near $200 million, indicating AI’s outsized appeal to investors.

Companies that were early adopters of AI have experienced significant gains, particularly those specializing in graphics processing units (GPUs), AI chips, and generative AI technologies. The median returns of AI-linked firms in the S&P 500 stand at 20%, compared to just 2% for non-AI stocks. AI companies are also responsible for 90% of the total returns on the NASDAQ Composite Index. These gains are expected to drive earnings growth and contribute to broader economic expansion. According to Joseph Briggs, a senior global economist at Goldman Sachs, AI is projected to automate 25% of all work tasks in the next decade, increasing US productivity by 9% and boosting GDP growth by more than 6%.

Read more about these developments by accessing 10 Best AI Data Center Stocks and 10 Buzzing AI Stocks According to Goldman Sachs.

Philippe Laffont of Coatue Management argues that AI could be the start of a new “super cycle” in the tech industry. Previous cycles included the rise of personal computers in the 1980s, networking in the 1990s, wired internet in the 2000s, and mobile internet in the 2010s, leading to the cloud era. However, software and internet experts Kash Rangan and Eric Sheridan highlight a key difference: this time, companies are linking AI investments directly to revenue generation, providing a financial safety net that was absent in past cycles.

Story Continues

Since the launch of ChatGPT by OpenAI in early 2023, the industry’s focus has shifted from software to AI hardware and infrastructure. AI infrastructure companies have collectively added nearly $6 trillion to their market capitalization since Q1 2023. Before large-scale AI automation becomes commonplace—MIT economist Daron Acemoglu estimates this will take more than a decade—AI infrastructure is expanding into areas such as utilities, energy, internet, and industrials. Interestingly, companies in these sectors that support AI development have posted returns rivaling those of traditional AI firms.

The growing demand for AI-driven data centers is also driving investments in the energy and utilities sectors. Goldman Sachs analysts Carly Davenport and Alberto Gandolf expect AI adoption to drive a surge in electricity demand not seen in decades. However, whether AI’s growth will align with energy infrastructure investments remains uncertain due to regulatory constraints and supply chain limitations in the utilities sector. Even if necessary investments materialize, their full benefits may take years to reach AI companies.

Read more about these developments by accessing 30 Most Important AI Stocks According to BlackRock and Beyond the Tech Giants: 35 Non-Tech AI Opportunities.

Some investors remain cautious, fearing an AI bubble similar to the dot-com crash of the early 2000s. However, current data suggests that AI valuations are far more grounded than those of the dot-com era. At the height of the dot-com bubble, software firms traded at price-to-earnings (P/E) ratios of 132x, compared to a five-year average of 37x in 1999. In contrast, in 2023, even the biggest AI stocks had P/E ratios around 39x, with a five-year average of 40x. These figures suggest that AI valuations are not overinflated, reinforcing investor confidence in AI’s long-term potential.

AI companies are increasingly targeting multi-trillion-dollar valuations, comparable to today’s largest software and internet firms. Over the past decade, tech giants have scaled their businesses to unprecedented levels, combining billions of users, hundreds of billions in revenue, and tens of billions in net income. Today, a handful of firms account for 80% of the valuation of the Fortune 500. These companies dominate industries such as smartphones, e-commerce, cloud computing, and software-as-a-service (SaaS), all of which AI is poised to disrupt. As a result, these firms are aggressively incorporating AI into their business strategies to maintain market leadership.

Some investors worry that AI firms could overshadow software companies, impacting long-term valuations. The price-to-sales (P/S) ratio for software stocks, which peaked in 2021, is now at an all-time low. Slower earnings growth has also contributed to negative sentiment in the sector. Coatue’s research shows that over the next twelve months, only 1% of SaaS companies expect 30% earnings growth, down from 30% during the SaaS boom. However, as human-machine interaction shifts towards natural language processing and generative AI, software companies that successfully integrate AI into their platforms are likely to thrive.

As inflation cools, rate hikes ease, and prospects for a soft economic landing improve, AI’s macroeconomic outlook remains strong. AI is now the primary driver of future earnings growth in the S&P 500. According to Coatue’s projections, AI-linked stocks are expected to grow at a compound annual rate of nearly 20% over the next three years, outperforming non-AI stocks by approximately 14%. Additionally, 40% of future tech sector earnings are expected to be fueled by AI advancements. All available data points to a bright future for AI investments, with its influence extending far beyond traditional tech firms. As companies continue integrating AI into their operations, productivity and economic growth are set to accelerate, making AI one of the most transformative forces in modern history.

For this article, we selected AI stocks by combing through a note on the AI industry by Coatue Management. These stocks are also popular among other hedge funds. Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds pile into? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).Apple Inc. (AAPL): Integrating AI in Devices for Personal Privacy

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders: 158

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a consumer electronics firm. In October 2024, the company launched Apple Intelligence, a personal AI system for iPhone, iPad, and Mac, designed to assist users in writing, expressing themselves, and completing tasks efficiently. This system emphasizes user privacy by processing data on-device, ensuring personal information remains secure. Financially, Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported a record revenue of $94.9 billion in the September 2024 quarter, marking a 6% increase from the previous year. CEO Tim Cook attributed this growth to the introduction of new products, including the iPhone 16 lineup, Apple Watch Series 10, and AirPods 4. Despite the introduction of AI features, the iPhone 16 series did not experience a significant sales boost, leading to concerns about the immediate financial benefits of AI.

Overall, AAPL ranks 6th on our list of Coatue’s most important AI stocks. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns, and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for a stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 20 Best AI Stocks To Buy Now and Complete List of 59 AI Companies Under $2 Billion in Market Cap

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple's integration of AI technologies, which aligns with current market trends favoring AI advancement and investment. The recognition of Apple as a significant player in the AI space, coupled with its recent record revenue report, suggests optimistic growth potential. The broader tech sector is rallying, driven by AI developments, which enhances confidence in Apple's future earnings. However, concerns about the immediate financial benefits of AI integration for specific product launches may temper stock reactions. Overall, the prevailing sentiment toward AI's transformative power and Apple's strategic positioning lends itself to a higher probability of stock price increase.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. On one hand, Apple is actively integrating AI, as evidenced by the launch of "Apple Intelligence," aligning with the broader AI-driven rally in the tech sector. This integration could be a positive catalyst. However, the article mentions that the recent iPhone 16 launch, despite AI features, did not result in a significant sales boost, raising concerns about immediate financial benefits. The article also contains a statement that there are AI stocks that are "more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings... cheapest AI stock," suggesting there may be better opportunities in the AI sector than AAPL. Given the mixed signals and Apple's comparatively lower ranking (6th) among Coatue's AI stocks, the probability of a price rise and fall is relatively balanced, however with more positive indicators for continued growth in the short-term. Therefore, I'm estimating a slightly higher probability for a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news article highlights the overall positive sentiment surrounding AI and its impact on the tech sector, with Apple (AAPL) positioned as a significant player.  However, the article also presents a nuanced view of Apple's AI integration. While Apple reported record revenue, the impact of its newly launched AI features (Apple Intelligence) on sales wasn't significantly apparent in iPhone 16 sales.  The article even suggests other AI stocks offer potentially higher returns in a shorter timeframe.  This mixed message suggests that while the broader AI market optimism could support AAPL's price, the specific impact of Apple's AI initiatives remains uncertain in the short term. Therefore, the probability of a stock price rise is moderate, while the probability of a fall is relatively low, given Apple's overall strong financial performance and position in the market. The article's emphasis on other AI stocks as potentially more lucrative further tempers the positive outlook for AAPL in the short term.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The article highlights Apple Inc.'s integration of AI into its devices, focusing on personal privacy with the launch of Apple Intelligence. While the company reported a record revenue increase (6% year-over-year), concerns about the immediate financial impact of AI features on iPhone sales were noted. Given the broader AI-driven market rally and Apple's strong brand and financials, the positive sentiment around AI is likely to outweigh short-term sales concerns. However, the lack of a significant sales boost from AI features introduces some uncertainty. The overall positive macroeconomic outlook for AI and Apple's strategic positioning in this space suggest a higher probability of stock price rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article highlights Apple's integration of AI in its devices for personal privacy, specifically mentioning the launch of Apple Intelligence. This move is expected to enhance user experience and privacy, which could positively impact Apple's stock price. Additionally, the article mentions Apple's record revenue of $94.9 billion in the September 2024 quarter, a 6% increase from the previous year. However, the iPhone 16 series did not experience a significant sales boost despite the introduction of AI features, which might temper immediate financial benefits. Overall, the integration of AI and strong financial performance suggest a positive outlook, but the lack of immediate sales boost from AI features introduces some caution.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's integration of AI in its devices for personal privacy, which is a positive development for the company. The article also mentions the growing demand for AI-driven technology and the potential for AI to drive earnings growth in the tech sector. However, it notes that some investors are cautious about an AI bubble and that Apple's introduction of AI features did not lead to a significant sales boost. Despite this, the overall tone of the article suggests that Apple's investment in AI is a strategic move that could lead to long-term growth. Therefore, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is higher than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's integration of AI into devices emphasizing privacy, coupled with strong recent financial performance. While Apple ranks 6th on the list of important AI stocks and has demonstrated significant market presence, the news suggests ongoing strategic advancements. However, there is cautious optimism regarding the immediate financial benefits of AI, as evidenced by the iPhone 16 series' modest sales impact.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive sentiment towards AI integration, notably with Apple's launch of Apple Intelligence aimed at enhancing user privacy. This aligns with broader trends in the tech sector, which is currently benefiting from AI-related advancements. Apple's reported record revenue growth of 6% year-over-year also boosts prospects for future earnings. However, concerns about the lack of a significant sales increase for the iPhone 16 series, despite AI enhancements, temper the outlook. The article hints at other companies offering potentially greater returns, which introduces hesitation regarding Apple's immediate prospects in the AI space. Overall, while the broader AI market sentiment is strong, the mixed signals regarding Apple's specific performance lead to a moderately optimistic outlook, predicting a higher chance of stock price rise but with some possibility of decline due to existing concerns.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.63, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.37, Reasoning: The overarching sentiment surrounding Apple's integration of AI for personal privacy remains cautiously optimistic, mirroring previous round predictions. The consistent highlighting of Apple's record revenue alongside concerns about immediate financial returns from AI integration offers a balanced perspective. The prior rounds generally converge towards a slightly positive outlook. Accounting for this consensus, and acknowledging the potential for short to medium-term volatility due to uncertainty in AI integration returns, a moderate upwards probability adjustment maintains the probability of stock price increase just above the threshold of stock price decrease. Note that Round 0 indicated that there may be other more promising AI sotcks, indicating a potential lower stock price prediction.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news is mixed. While Apple's record revenue and integration of AI are positive, the lack of a significant sales boost from the iPhone 16's AI features introduces uncertainty.  The article also highlights other AI stocks as potentially more lucrative investment opportunities.  The overall positive sentiment around AI in the market is a supporting factor but isn't solely focused on Apple. Considering the previous predictions, which range from 0.55 to 0.7 for a price rise, and the nuanced nature of the news itself, a probability slightly above 0.5 for a price rise seems reasonable, acknowledging the potential for a price fall given the lack of immediate, substantial impact of the AI features on sales.  The consensus among the previous models suggests a slightly higher probability for a rise but not overwhelmingly so.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple's strategic integration of AI into its devices, emphasizing personal privacy with the launch of Apple Intelligence. Apple's record revenue of $94.9 billion in the September 2024 quarter, a 6% year-over-year increase, underscores its strong financial performance. The overall positive sentiment around AI and Apple's position as a key player in the AI space suggests a higher probability of stock price rise, though the lack of immediate sales boost tempers this optimism slightly. The consensus from previous predictions also leans towards a higher probability of rise, with most models estimating between 0.6 and 0.7.
